alert.note: Alert for Merrick; Nance; Polk (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:13AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Nance, northeastern Merrick and northern Polk Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 812 AM CDT, an automated weather station reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Platte Center to 6 miles northeast of Clarks. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Osceola around 830 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Shelby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
